title: Business Council of Australia - Wikipedia
snippet: The Business Council of Australia (BCA) is an industry association that comprises the chief executives of more than 130 of Australia's biggest corporations. It was formed in 1983 by the merger of the Business Roundtable – a spin-off of the Committee for Economic Development of Australia – ...

title: New BCA President starts today - Business Council of Australia
snippet: 24 April 2025 Read more ... The Business Council of Australia welcomes incoming BCA President Geoff Culbert, who today takes over leadership of the BCA Board from outgoing President Tim Reed.

title: Business Council of Australia proposes five critical questions for the next Australian government - AICD
snippet: Former Sydney Airport CEO Geoff Culbert became president of the Business Council of Australia (BCA) in February 2024, when CEO Bran Black, a lawyer and former government adviser, was just six months into his new role at the powerful advocacy group.
